abstract.para: The behavior of &nm; is defined in the /etc/NetworkManager/NetworkManager.conf file.

topic.para: You can configure the settings on how &nm; must behave such as the connectivity details, logging and so on in the NetworkManager.conf file.

The central configuration file for &nm; /etc/NetworkManager/NetworkManager.conf is the primary location for configuring behavior and settings of &nm;, including logging, connection management, and network device handling.

The file consists of sections of key-value pairs. Each key-value pair must belong to a section. A section starts with a name enclosed in []. Lines beginning with a # are considered comments. A common configuration includes the [main] section with the plugins value, [logging], and [connectivity]:

listitem.para: [logging] manages the &nm; logging levels and domains.
[keyfile] manages how the connection profiles are stored.

topic.para: The [keyfile] plug-in supports all the connection types and capabilities of &nm;.
The default configuration file contains the connectivity section that specifies the URI to check the network connection.
